subject: Relationships
title: Attachment Styles Shape Communication
description: A fast breakdown of Attachment Styles Shape Communication for builders.

hook.text: An anxious partner texts five times. An avoidant partner needs space. Both feel abandoned. Both are right.

buildup.text: Attachment theory says our childhood bonds shape how we communicate in adult relationships.

discovery.text: Anxious types chase closeness. Avoidant types protect independence. The pairing creates a painful dance.

twist.text: Securely attached people aren't conflict-free. They just repair faster and take rejection less personally.

climax.text: Your attachment style is the invisible script running behind every argument and every loving gesture.

punchline.text: How you were loved as a child shapes how you argue as an adult.

quiz.question: What happens when anxious and avoidant attachment styles pair?
options: A push-pull dynamic where both feel unsatisfied
